August 28, 1988: Fiction
THE CARDINAL OF THE KREMLIN, by Tom Clancy. (Putnam, $19.95.) The
C.I.A.'s Jack Ryan races to the rescue of America's highest-ranking secret agent
in the Soviet Union.
TILL WE MEET AGAIN, by Judith Krantz. (Crown, $19.95.) The exploits of a
woman and her two daughters from pre-World War I Paris to present-day Los
Angeles.
ALASKA, by James A. Michener. (Random House, $22.50.) The history of the
49th state told in fictional form.
DOCTORS, by Erich Segal. (Bantam, $19.95.) The life stories of five members of
Harvard Medical School's class of 1962.
TO BE THE BEST, by Barbara Taylor Bradford. (Doubleday, $19.95.) The Harte
department store dynasty, founded by ''a woman of substance,'' undergoes
emotional and financial strains.
THE BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES, by Tom Wolfe. (Farrar, Straus & Giroux,
$19.95.) A bond trader caught in the jungles of New York.
ZOYA, by Danielle Steel. (Delacorte, $19.95.) One woman's story, from St.
Petersburg during the Russian Revolution to Paris in the 1920's to contemporary
New York.
A THIEF OF TIME, by Tony Hillerman. (Harper & Row, $15.95.) Tracking down a
missing archeologist, missing artifacts and a murderer in the Indian ruins of New
Mexico.
TIMOTHY'S GAME, by Lawrence Sanders. (Putnam, $18.95.) A stock market
operator investigates scams on Wall Street and all around New York.
LOVE IN THE TIME OF CHOLERA, by Gabriel Garcia Marquez. (Knopf, $18.95.)
A Colombian poet's perdurable love for a woman is tested by life's changing
conditions.
DEMON LORD OF KARANDA, by David Eddings. (Del Rey/Ballantine, $18.95.)
The battle for control of a continent continues in the fantasy saga ''The Malloreon.''
THE ICARUS AGENDA, by Robert Ludlum. (Random House, $19.95.) A
congressman's secret dealings with terrorists may bring him the Presidency - or
death.
THE SHELL SEEKERS, by Rosamunde Pilcher. (St. Martin's, $19.95.) A woman
and a painting tie together three generations of an English family.
SHINING THROUGH, by Susan Isaacs. (Harper & Row, $18.95.) The progress of
August 28, 1988
Non-Fiction
A BRIEF HISTORY OF TIME, by Stephen W. Hawking. (Bantam, $18.95.) A
British scientist's review of efforts to create a unified theory of the universe.
TRUMP, by Donald J. Trump with Tony Schwartz. (Random House, $19.95.) The
career and business style of the New York entrepreneur.
GENERATION OF SWINE, by Hunter S. Thompson. (Summit, $18.95.)
Commentary on the current decade.
TALKING STRAIGHT, by Lee Iacocca with Sonny Kleinfield. (Bantam, $21.95.)
More experiences and opinions of the Chrysler chairman.
THE DUCHESS OF WINDSOR, by Charles Higham. (McGraw-Hill, $17.95.) The
life of the woman from Baltimore who married King Edward VIII.
THRIVING ON CHAOS, by Tom Peters. (Knopf, $19.95.) The author discusses
ways for companies to survive in today's and tomorrow's turbulent world.
RIDING THE IRON ROOSTER, by Paul Theroux. (Putnam, $21.95.) A yearlong
journey by train through China.
ALMOST GOLDEN, by Gwenda Blair. (Simon & Schuster, $18.95.) The career of
the television anchorwoman Jessica Savitch and the ways of newscasting during
the past two decades.
THE RAGMAN'S SON, by Kirk Douglas. (Simon & Schuster, $21.95.) The actor
recalls his life as poor immigrant's son, waiter, steel mill worker, haberdashery
salesman, film star, father and man.
PICASSO, by Arianna Stassinopoulos Huffington. (Simon & Schuster, $22.95.) A
portrait of the artist as ''creator and destroyer.''
FIREFIGHTERS, by Dennis Smith. (Doubleday, $18.95.) Three dozen men and
women from all parts of the country recall their most exciting experiences.
THE RISE AND FALL OF THE GREAT POWERS, by Paul Kennedy. (Random
House, $24.95.) How economic and military forces affected the fortunes of great
nations in the past 500 years.
CAPOTE, by Gerald Clarke. (Simon & Schuster, $22.95.) The life of Truman
Capote.
SENATORIAL PRIVILEGE, by Leo Damore. (Regnery Gateway, $19.95.) A
reporter's reassessment of the 1969 accident on Chappaquiddick Island.
A TRAIL OF MEMORIES, edited by Angelique L'Amour. (Bantam, $12.95.)
Quotations from the works of Louis L'Amour, compiled by his daughter.
